title: CBS Finds Success In Thursday Night Football
teaser: The network postponed its most popular evening lineup and replaced it with Thursday Night Football from the NFL.
contentencoded:
For part of this football season, CBS took a chance. The network postponed its most popular evening lineup and replaced it with Thursday Night Football from the NFL. That was a first for the league; normally Thursday games are only available to cable subscribers on the NFL Network.

The experiment turned out to be a great success for CBS, despite all of the controversy around the NFL this year. NPRâ€™s TV critic Eric Deggans talks to Here & Now’s Robin Young about why Thursday Night Football is working for CBS.

Guest

  • Eric Deggans, TV critic for NPR. He tweets @Deggans.
